mz">dribble</strong></a></figcaption></figure><p id="8770" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">In Java, <strong class="nc gv">null checks</strong> are generally done using <strong class="nc gv">== </strong>or<strong class="nc gv"> !=</strong>. In addition, if we want to do an<strong class="nc gv"> empty check</strong>, our condition will look like the following.</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="9247" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (myString != null || myString != ""){<br/>  // Not null or empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if(myList != null || myList.size() != 0){<br/>  // Not null or empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if (myObject != null) {<br/>  // Not Null<br/>}</span></pre><p id="9936" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">Such controls make your code repetitive and difficult to manage as it grows.</p><p id="dba4" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">This is where the <strong class="nc gv">Apache Commons Lang 3</strong> library comes in. We will examine 3 classes to make null or empty checks in objects and lists more reliable and more readable. First, let’s see how to add this library to our project.</p><h1 id="7e09" class="on oi gu bf mz oo op oq or os ot ou ov ow ox oy oz pa pb pc pd pe pf pg ph pi bk"><strong class="al">How to Add Apache Commons Lang3 to Your Project</strong></h1><p id="817a" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd pj nf ng nh pk nj nk nl pl nn no np pm nr ns nt pn nv nw nx gn bk">If you are using Maven, you can add the following dependency to your pom.xml file:</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="a518" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om"><dependency><br/>    <groupId>org.apache.commons</groupId><br/>    <artifactId>commons-lang3</artifactId><br/>    <version>3.12.0</version> <!-- Check the version --><br/></dependency></span></pre><p id="b0f4" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">If you are using Gradle, you can add the following dependency to your build.gradle file:</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="da9b" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">implementation 'org.apache.commons:commons-configuration2:2.11.0'  // Check the version</span></pre><h1 id="fb0d" class="on oi gu bf mz oo op oq or os ot ou ov ow ox oy oz pa pb pc pd pe pf pg ph pi bk">ObjectUtils for General Null Checks</h1><p id="3aab" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd pj nf ng nh pk nj nk nl pl nn no np pm nr ns nt pn nv nw nx gn bk">ObjectUtils has several useful methods that you can use to check objects and assign default values. Two of them are the <strong class="nc gv">isEmpty </strong>and <strong class="nc gv">isNotEmpty</strong> methods. These methods check whether the object is <strong class="nc gv">null or empty.</strong></p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="55d6" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (ObjectUtils.isEmpty(myObject)) {<br/>  // Null or empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if (ObjectUtils.isNotEmpty(myObject)) {<br/>  // Not null or empty<br/>}</span></pre><p id="3fe6" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">Alternatively, you can also use <strong class="nc gv">Java Util</strong>.</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="6d82" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (Objects.isNull(myObject)) {<br/>  // Null or empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if (Objects.nonNull(myObject)) {<br/>  // Not null or empty<br/>}</span></pre><p id="ebb3" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">If you want to assign a default value to an object in case it is null, you can use the <strong class="nc gv">defaultIfNull </strong>method of the <strong class="nc gv">ObjectUtils </strong>class.</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="5d97" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">Integer age = ObjectUtils.defaultIfNull(inputAge, 18);</span></pre><h1 id="d237" class="on oi gu bf mz oo op oq or os ot ou ov ow ox oy oz pa pb pc pd pe pf pg ph pi bk">Checking Strings for Null or Empty with StringUtils</h1><p id="dd50" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd pj nf ng nh pk nj nk nl pl nn no np pm nr ns nt pn nv nw nx gn bk">Especially when working with String values, we need to do a lot of <strong class="nc gv">null or empty</strong> checking. In this case, we can easily do this with the <strong class="nc gv">StringUtils </strong>class.</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="f2cf" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (StringUtils.isBlank(myString)) {<br/>  // String is null, empty or contains only spaces<br/>}<br/><br/>if (StringUtils.isNotBlank(myString)) {<br/>  // String contains a valid value<br/>}</span></pre><p id="880c" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">If you only want to check for <strong class="nc gv">null </strong>or <strong class="nc gv">empty</strong>;</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="da85" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (StringUtils.isEmpty(myString)) {<br/>  // String null or empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if (StringUtils.isNotEmpty(myString)) {<br/>  // String contains a valid value (Can contain only spaces)<br/>}</span></pre><p id="f624" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">If the string is <strong class="nc gv">null or empty</strong> and you want to assign a default value to it;</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="37cd" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">String name = StringUtils.defaultIfBlank(inputName, "John Doe");</span></pre><p id="3d9e" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">This allows us to assign a safe default value if the Strings are <strong class="nc gv">null, empty or space.</strong></p><h1 id="fd57" class="on oi gu bf mz oo op oq or os ot ou ov ow ox oy oz pa pb pc pd pe pf pg ph pi bk">Collection Checks with CollectionUtils</h1><p id="1761" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd pj nf ng nh pk nj nk nl pl nn no np pm nr ns nt pn nv nw nx gn bk">When working with collections, it is essential to check for lists that are empty. With the<strong class="nc gv"> CollectionUtils</strong> class you can make such checks quite simple.</p><p id="d61a" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">To check if a collection is <strong class="nc gv">empty</strong>;</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="ec4c" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (CollectionUtils.isEmpty(myList)) {<br/>    // List is empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if (CollectionUtils.isNotEmpty(myList)) {<br/>    // List is valid<br/>}</span></pre><p id="94e1" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">In this way, we can do both checks at once and make the <strong class="nc gv">code cleaner.</strong></p><p id="b4cd" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">With <strong class="nc gv">Apache Commons Lang 3</strong>, you can make your code <strong class="nc gv">cleaner, reliable and maintainable</strong> by performing<strong class="nc gv"> null checks</strong> in Java more easily. With this library, which is very easy to include in the project, you can reduce code complexity in your Java projects and create a better quality software development process by minimizing errors.</p></div></div></div><div class="ab cb po pp pq pr" role="separator"><span class="ps by bm pt pu pv"></span><span class="ps by bm pt pu pv"></span><span class="ps by bm pt pu"></span></div><div class="gn go gp gq gr"><div class="ab cb"><div class="ci bh fz ga gb gc"><p id="a01c" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">Thank you for reading my article! mz">dribble</strong></a></figcaption></figure><p id="8770" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">In Java, <strong class="nc gv">null checks</strong> are generally done using <strong class="nc gv">== </strong>or<strong class="nc gv"> !=</strong>. In addition, if we want to do an<strong class="nc gv"> empty check</strong>, our condition will look like the following.</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="9247" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (myString != null || myString != ""){<br/>  // Not null or empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if(myList != null || myList.size() != 0){<br/>  // Not null or empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if (myObject != null) {<br/>  // Not Null<br/>}</span></pre><p id="9936" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">Such controls make your code repetitive and difficult to manage as it grows.</p><p id="dba4" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">This is where the <strong class="nc gv">Apache Commons Lang 3</strong> library comes in. We will examine 3 classes to make null or empty checks in objects and lists more reliable and more readable. First, let’s see how to add this library to our project.</p><h1 id="7e09" class="on oi gu bf mz oo op oq or os ot ou ov ow ox oy oz pa pb pc pd pe pf pg ph pi bk"><strong class="al">How to Add Apache Commons Lang3 to Your Project</strong></h1><p id="817a" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd pj nf ng nh pk nj nk nl pl nn no np pm nr ns nt pn nv nw nx gn bk">If you are using Maven, you can add the following dependency to your pom.xml file:</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="a518" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om"><dependency><br/>    <groupId>org.apache.commons</groupId><br/>    <artifactId>commons-lang3</artifactId><br/>    <version>3.12.0</version> <!-- Check the version --><br/></dependency></span></pre><p id="b0f4" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">If you are using Gradle, you can add the following dependency to your build.gradle file:</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="da9b" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">implementation 'org.apache.commons:commons-configuration2:2.11.0'  // Check the version</span></pre><h1 id="fb0d" class="on oi gu bf mz oo op oq or os ot ou ov ow ox oy oz pa pb pc pd pe pf pg ph pi bk">ObjectUtils for General Null Checks</h1><p id="3aab" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd pj nf ng nh pk nj nk nl pl nn no np pm nr ns nt pn nv nw nx gn bk">ObjectUtils has several useful methods that you can use to check objects and assign default values. Two of them are the <strong class="nc gv">isEmpty </strong>and <strong class="nc gv">isNotEmpty</strong> methods. These methods check whether the object is <strong class="nc gv">null or empty.</strong></p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="55d6" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (ObjectUtils.isEmpty(myObject)) {<br/>  // Null or empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if (ObjectUtils.isNotEmpty(myObject)) {<br/>  // Not null or empty<br/>}</span></pre><p id="3fe6" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">Alternatively, you can also use <strong class="nc gv">Java Util</strong>.</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="6d82" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (Objects.isNull(myObject)) {<br/>  // Null or empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if (Objects.nonNull(myObject)) {<br/>  // Not null or empty<br/>}</span></pre><p id="ebb3" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">If you want to assign a default value to an object in case it is null, you can use the <strong class="nc gv">defaultIfNull </strong>method of the <strong class="nc gv">ObjectUtils </strong>class.</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="5d97" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">Integer age = ObjectUtils.defaultIfNull(inputAge, 18);</span></pre><h1 id="d237" class="on oi gu bf mz oo op oq or os ot ou ov ow ox oy oz pa pb pc pd pe pf pg ph pi bk">Checking Strings for Null or Empty with StringUtils</h1><p id="dd50" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd pj nf ng nh pk nj nk nl pl nn no np pm nr ns nt pn nv nw nx gn bk">Especially when working with String values, we need to do a lot of <strong class="nc gv">null or empty</strong> checking. In this case, we can easily do this with the <strong class="nc gv">StringUtils </strong>class.</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="f2cf" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (StringUtils.isBlank(myString)) {<br/>  // String is null, empty or contains only spaces<br/>}<br/><br/>if (StringUtils.isNotBlank(myString)) {<br/>  // String contains a valid value<br/>}</span></pre><p id="880c" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">If you only want to check for <strong class="nc gv">null </strong>or <strong class="nc gv">empty</strong>;</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="da85" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (StringUtils.isEmpty(myString)) {<br/>  // String null or empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if (StringUtils.isNotEmpty(myString)) {<br/>  // String contains a valid value (Can contain only spaces)<br/>}</span></pre><p id="f624" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">If the string is <strong class="nc gv">null or empty</strong> and you want to assign a default value to it;</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="37cd" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">String name = StringUtils.defaultIfBlank(inputName, "John Doe");</span></pre><p id="3d9e" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">This allows us to assign a safe default value if the Strings are <strong class="nc gv">null, empty or space.</strong></p><h1 id="fd57" class="on oi gu bf mz oo op oq or os ot ou ov ow ox oy oz pa pb pc pd pe pf pg ph pi bk">Collection Checks with CollectionUtils</h1><p id="1761" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd pj nf ng nh pk nj nk nl pl nn no np pm nr ns nt pn nv nw nx gn bk">When working with collections, it is essential to check for lists that are empty. With the<strong class="nc gv"> CollectionUtils</strong> class you can make such checks quite simple.</p><p id="d61a" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">To check if a collection is <strong class="nc gv">empty</strong>;</p><pre class="ny nz oa ob oc od oe of bp og bb bk"><span id="ec4c" class="oh oi gu oe b bg oj ok l ol om">if (CollectionUtils.isEmpty(myList)) {<br/>    // List is empty<br/>}<br/><br/>if (CollectionUtils.isNotEmpty(myList)) {<br/>    // List is valid<br/>}</span></pre><p id="94e1" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">In this way, we can do both checks at once and make the <strong class="nc gv">code cleaner.</strong></p><p id="b4cd" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">With <strong class="nc gv">Apache Commons Lang 3</strong>, you can make your code <strong class="nc gv">cleaner, reliable and maintainable</strong> by performing<strong class="nc gv"> null checks</strong> in Java more easily. With this library, which is very easy to include in the project, you can reduce code complexity in your Java projects and create a better quality software development process by minimizing errors.</p></div></div></div><div class="ab cb po pp pq pr" role="separator"><span class="ps by bm pt pu pv"></span><span class="ps by bm pt pu pv"></span><span class="ps by bm pt pu"></span></div><div class="gn go gp gq gr"><div class="ab cb"><div class="ci bh fz ga gb gc"><p id="a01c" class="pw-post-body-paragraph na nb gu nc b nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl nm nn no np nq nr ns nt nu nv nw nx gn bk">Thank you for reading my article!
